title: Riot, you cant say damage is to high and then buff Yasuo's damage right after.
body:
> Yasuo
> Last Breath (R) bonus AD increased from 150% to 250%

Have you guys actually fucking lost your minds? You just admitted damage was too high, and then you go and give one of the highest damage champions in the game MORE fucking damage?

This is actually fucking madness, Please someone stop these maniacs!

The same thing happened to Lee a long time ago. They tried to re-balance the damage in his kit and fanboys EXPLODED.

Happens for every champion. It's just that Yasuo, Zed, Lee and the like are either stupendously popular or played by only mains/one-tricks. In either case any large-scale change is going to make many of those people really angry. Take note that those are also only damage dealing champions, burst or not. I don't recall any outburst of negative comments for the, say, Sejuani rework (though I might be wrong) - but Sejuani is a tank. One that doesn't fall in the category "Builds full tank and kills you with just base damage".

Sej actually had better kill pressure from snowballing pre-rework. Her defense passive was considered a joke, but her AP bruiser status was actually pretty good. She'd pop out behind your tower from the jungle and pretty much 50-0 you then waltz out from under the tower with 80% health left. Now most of her damage is locked up in a 4 stack passive that "allows" her a stun and %HP hit but massively fails against Riot's favored outplay mobility picks because its so damn hard to land four blasted stacks on a hyper mobile over tuned carry as a melee with all the delays in the kit. Rework cost her easily accessed area slow, an auto-reset, and her AP scaling option.
No, they said that the direction they were aiming for didn't pan out.

No.

It's a 40% increase.

https://i.gyazo.com/f976d7d36d759a991ba51304366303d5.png
Actually, buffing the damage from 150% AD to 250% AD means the original scaling was buffed by 66% (100 is 66% of 150).
That's not how you calculate an increase.

Imagine a mage getting a 60% AP ratio buff to their ult. Just an example.

{{champion:1}} Ult goes from 65% AP ratio to 125% AP ratio.

That is essentially what's going on here, and as a die hard Annie fan, even jotting that down as an *idea* makes me wanna smack myself. I imagine most Yasuo fans feel the same way.

What's even worse is that this is exactly the kind of damage increase that contributes to one-shots. If Yasuo had received an increase to his AD, attack speed, or Q damage, it would still be unwarranted, but at least it'd play more to his DPS. Adding 100% bonus AD to his ult means his punishing combo will deal even more burst damage, and therefore be even more likely to kill champions while they're being stunlocked/airborne. I don't understand why this change would ever occur.
If anything they should have removed its hidden passive that attempts to move him out of tower range while ulting.
